intro: Cirrhopetalum multiflorum, commonly known as the many-flowered cirrhopetalum, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a velvety texture. The flowers, which range in color from white to pale pink, attract a variety of pollinators including bees and butterflies.
